time_of_occurence: Throughout the year (severe during rainy season)
incidence: Severe yield loss due to growth retardation
place_of_occurence: Bogor, Lembang, Tasikmalaya, Garut and Malang, Java, Indonesia
reference: Rachmat, A. S., Kobayashi, T., & Oniki, M. (1994). Angular Leaf Spot of Ramie (Boehmeria nivea) Caused by Pseudocercospora boehmeriae in Indonesia. Japanese Journal of Tropical Agriculture, 38(1), 59–64.

place_of_occurence: Yuanjiang (E:112.33, N:28.16) Hunan Province and Xianning (E:114.18, N:29.49) Hubei Province, China
reference: Yu, Y., Zeng, L., Huang, L., Yan, Z., Sun, K., Zhu, T., & Zhu, A. (2016). First Report of Black Leaf Spot Caused by Alternaria alternata on Ramie in China. Journal of Phytopathology, 164, 358–361. https://doi.org/10.1111/jph.12428

time_of_occurence: During the vegetative growth phase of ramie (up to four generations per year in central and south China)
incidence: Can cause severe yield reduction due to leaf and shoot damage
place_of_occurence: China (mainly central and southern regions)
reference: Zeng, L., Shen, A., Chen, J., Yan, Z., Liu, T., Xue, Z., & Yu, Y. (2016). Transcriptome Analysis of Ramie (Boehmeria nivea L. Gaud.) in Response to Ramie Moth (Cocytodes coerulea Guenée) Infestation. BioMed Research International, 2016, 3702789. https://doi.org/10.1155/2016/3702789
